channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.description:
Dumped stools / chairs
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fieldfare Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a dead gox in a comunity sharing green bin, 29th December
item.description:
I woke up today to pick up the bins from the path after rubish collection to bring them back and the green bin was heavy. I opened the lid and there is a dead fox there. I left it outside and i called enviroment health team to report it but it was around 6 pm. I told my neighbours and i hope the council will come in the morning to clear up our sharing bin. 36 charlton church lane SE7 7AE
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Charlton Church Lane, Charlton
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Incorrect Information + Broken Fence, 29th December
item.description:
New signs have incorrect opening times and non existent emergency contact telephone number for Bromley Council. Correct times shown on pic. Fence adjacent to gate has been forcefully removed to allow car out. (tyre marks over grass verge confirm). Signs need to be replaced by Veolia to show correct times and a telephone number that is correct. Veolia also need to open gates and not leave closed all day. Residents want to park in car park to use Country Park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tent Peg Lane, Petts Wood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car blocking the driveway entrance and we can not enter, 29th December
item.description:
This vehicle was parked for 70 minutes. He told us he was awaiting for AA to pick him up. We can not enter our flat as he was blocking it the whole time. As we were watching him over our window we saw that a woman approached her who was parked in the bus lane of chandos avenue and then he left. I have a video taken when he left the driveway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Road, Whetstone, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter near planters on Tabard street, 29th December
item.description:
There is a rubbish bag, food packaging and clothes dumped at the planters on Tabard Street. The items are still there despite fixmystreet stating it was removed. Please can it cleaned up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pilgrimage Street, The Borough, Greater London
